articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Chongjin Univ. of Mining and Metallurgy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Chongjin Univ. of Mining and Metallurgy
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to Chongjin University of Mining and Metallurgy.
					 He looked round the heat and hydraulic machine research room, the metal engineering laboratory, the comprehensive analytical laboratory, the IT operation room, the E-library and other places of the university to acquaint himself in detail with education and scientific researches there. 
					
					 He highly appreciated the successes made by the teachers of the university, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that they have created an excellent environment for education as required by the developing reality and brought about a fresh turn in teaching and education and scientific researches. 
					
					The teachers including professors and doctors of the university who are intensely loyal to the party and the revolution are the reliable intellectuals who have single-mindedly supported the revolutionary cause of Juche with science and technology, he said, adding that the country has a rosy future as such revolutionary and militant intellectuals are standing firm on the front of education.
					
					 He advanced important tasks which would serve as guidelines for developing the university.
					
					 He underscored the need for the university to train in a brief span of time more scientists and technicians possessed of a high technical level to solve immediate issues arising in putting the national economy on a Juche-oriented, modern and scientific basis and, at the same time, widely explore new scientific and technological fields of weighty importance in the development of the nation's mining and metal industries to make a positive contribution to significantly developing the nation's overall science and technology.
					
					 He called for turning the university into a model university having an impeccable appearance as a university of technology and again showed loving care for it.
					
					  He was accompanied by Hong Sok Hyong, chief secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek and Pak Nam Gi, department directors of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Document Signed between DPRK and Chinese Security Ministries
articles.content:
Document Signed between DPRK and Chinese Security Ministries
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A document on offer of aid materials between the DPRK Ministry of People's Security and the Chinese Ministry of Public Security was signed in Beijing with due ceremony on Dec. 16.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the Ministry of People's Security led by Minister Ju Sang Song and the DPRK ambassador to China and from the opposite side Minister of Public Security Meng Jianzhu and officials concerned.
					
					 Ju and Meng inked the document.

articles.title: Sojourn of US Businessmen Delegation in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Sojourn of US Businessmen Delegation in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The delegation of U.S. businessmen headed by General Charles Boyd, president and CEO of the Business Executives for National Security (BENS),  stayed here from Dec. 14 to 17.
					 During its stay in the DPRK the delegation visited Kim Il Sung University, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Grand People's Study House, the Pyongyang Metro, the Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory, etc. It had an exhaustive discussion with officials in the economic field of the DPRK on the issues arising in creating environment for investment.

articles.title: US Businessmen Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
US Businessmen Delegation Leaves
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The delegation of U.S. businessmen headed by General Charles Boyd, president and CEO of the Business Executives for National Security (BENS), flew back on Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Nigerien President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Nigerien President 
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Mamadou Tandja, President of Niger, on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of proclamation of the Republic of Niger.
					Kim in the message wished the President and the people of Niger great successes in the work for national unity and stability and development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Qatar Emir
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Qatar Emir 
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Hamad Bin Khalifa Al-Thani, emir of Qatar, on the occasion of its independence day.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, Kim in the message sincerely wished the emir greater success in his work for development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Greets Qatar PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Greets Qatar PM 
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Kim Yong Il Thursday sent a message of greetings to Prime Minister of Qatar Sheikh Hamad Bin Jassim Bin Jabor Al-Thani on the occasion of the independence day of Qatar.
					 Highly appreciating the efforts made by the government of Qatar for its economic development and prosperity, the message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would steadily grow stronger.

articles.title: National Memorial Service for O Jung Hup Held
articles.content:
National Memorial Service for O Jung Hup Held
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A national memorial service for O Jung Hup, a revolutionary fighter, took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of his death.
					 Present there were senior party, army and state officials, the chairman of a friendly party, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army, bereaved family members of revolutionary martyrs and working people in the city. 
					
					 O Jung Hup, born into the poorest peasant family in Onsong County, North Hamgyong Province, devotedly defended the headquarters of the revolution from the very day he embarked upon the road of anti-Japanese revolution. He died a heroic death in the Liukesong battle in Dunhua County on December 17, Juche 28 (1939) in the period of the large-unit circling operation in the northeastern part of Mt. Paektu while displaying matchless self-sacrificing spirit in the struggle for materializing the idea, line and operational plan of President Kim Il Sung. O was 29 at that time.
					
					 General of the KPA Kim Jong Gak, member of the DPRK National Defence Commission and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, in his memorial address said that brief as his life was, O Jung Hup's life was a worthwhile one as he taught from what stand and attitude the revolutionaries should uphold and devotedly defend their leader and how they should live and struggle for the party, the revolution, the country and its people.
					
					 Recalling that O Jung Hup made long journeys for bloody anti-Japanese battles like a phoenix, his heart burning with the determination to protect the headquarters of the revolution despite manifold hardships and trials baffling human imagination, Kim Jong Gak stressed that O's exploits always remain shining in the history of the Korean revolution as a distinguished example in devotedly defending the leader.
					
					 The speaker went on:
					
					 Much water has flown under the bridge since O's death but Kim Il Sung highly estimated his feats, not forgetting the departed soldier. He wrote about O's life in his Reminiscences, making it shine, and took utmost care of the O family and the only child of the fighter with fatherly love.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il said O was a typical revolutionary soldier who remained intensely loyal to the President and a vanguard fighter who protected him at the risk of his life, the speaker noted, adding that the leader made sure that his bust was erected at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the KPA units waged the Movement for Winning the Title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment.
					
					 Kim Jong Gak called upon all the servicepersons and people to defend Kim Jong Il politically and ideologically and with their lives in any adversity just as the revolutionary forerunners created the heroic epic of devotedly defending the leader in the course of long journeys of bloody anti-Japanese battles and become fighters devotedly protecting the leader in the Songun era who share idea, will and destiny with the headquarters of the revolution.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of O Jung Hup
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of O Jung Hup
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the bust of O Jung Hup, a revolutionary martyr, at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong Thursday on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of his demise.
					 Seen there was a wreath from Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were O Kuk Ryol and Kim Il Chol, officials of armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions, officials of city-level organs and KPA servicepersons, the bereaved family and working people in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					 Wreaths, together with flowers, were laid in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the State Planning Commission, the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport, the Ministry of Capital City Construction and the Pyongyang Clothing Industry Management Bureau.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of O Jung Hup.

articles.title: Wreath Placed before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wreath Placed before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A wreath was placed before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong by women of embassies of various countries and missions of international organizations here Thursday on the occasion of her 92nd birth anniversary.  
					 They placed the wreath before the bust in boundless reverence and paid silent tribute to her. 
					
					 Written on the ribbon of the wreath were words: "The revolutionary feats of Comrade Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, will be immortal!"

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception for officials of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces at his embassy on Wednesday on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 99 (2010).
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, general officers and officers of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Officials of the Chinese embassy were on hand. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Palestinian Embassies Visit Jonsung Revolutionary Museum
articles.content:
Palestinian Embassies Visit Jonsung Revolutionary Museum
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy visited the Jonsung Revolutionary Museum Thursday on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the start of the Palestinian revolution.
					 The guests made a bow to the mosaic portraying President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They went round with keen interest offices, tunnel, etc. being briefed on the fact that the President led the army and people of the DPRK to victory during the great Fatherland Liberation War with his Juche-based strategy and war methods and wise leadership and mapped the grand plan for postwar rehabilitation and construction with his clairvoyant wisdom.

articles.title: Women of Foreign Missions Visit Museum
articles.content:
Women of Foreign Missions Visit Museum
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Women of various embassies and missions of international organizations here visited the Revolutionary Museum of the Ministry of Railways Thursday on the occasion of the 92nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine.
					 Being briefed on her revolutionary life and immortal exploits, they looked round photos, historic relics and mementoes displayed in the museum.

articles.title: 10,000-ton Press Put on CNC Basis
articles.content:
10,000-ton Press Put on CNC Basis
Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The Chollima Steel Complex in the DPRK has put its 10,000-ton press on a Juche-oriented CNC basis.
					This press, 25 meters high and 3,000 tons in weight, is a product of self-reliance, which was manufactured by workers of Ryongsong with their own efforts and technology in the 1980s.
					
					 The introduction of CNC system has made it possible for the press to increase its production capacity ten times.
					
					 It helps automatically control at will type, pressure, precision, forging way and all other things needed according to state of materials and produce any forgings weighing hundreds tons at one operation.
					
					 This system increases the quantity of forgings by press ten times while ensuring their precision quadruple higher than before so that nearly finished products can be supplied to help machine-building bases radically decrease their processing hours and enhance their quality.
					
					 60 percent of power and water needed to produce pressure are saved to lower the norm of materials consumption per unit of output less than half.
					
					 This up-to-date press is now freely producing such heavy and large-size forgings as turbine axis of generator and rollers needed at socialist construction sites including the Huichon Power Station, the Kumyagang Power Station and the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex.

articles.title: Research in Wild Mushrooms Makes Progress
articles.content:
Research in Wild Mushrooms Makes Progress
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Research in wild mushrooms has been successfully made in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 In recent years scientists have deepened the study of mycotrophic mushrooms to discover their roles in forest ecosystem.
					
					 Tricholoma robustum and Tricholoma bakamatsutake growing in forests of oak trees produce gluconic acid, an organic one, to increase fertility of soil.
					
					 It has been discovered that Armillaria mellea and other parasitic mushrooms, though high in medical value, are unfavorable for forest protection as they rot living trees, growing on their roots and trunks.
					
					 The cultivation methods of these mushrooms are now under research, with some of them including Ganoderma lucida already domesticated.
					
					 Mushrooms of Cordyceps are useful in protecting forests for their killing harmful insects and taken as health food material.
					
					 Poisonous mushrooms are used in oncotherapy and production of bio-reagents.
					
					 Being absorbent of radioactive materials in soil, mushrooms are also good for protecting environment in general. 
					
					 Microbiologists have made successes in the research into pharmacological actions of Grifola frondosa and its cultivation method to be conducive to the health improvement.
					
					 More than 900 species of mushrooms are growing in the country, some 250 of them proved to be valuable.

articles.title: Colored Granite Made
articles.content:
Colored Granite Made
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Granites of diverse colors and patterns are drawing attention of architectural experts and people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 They have been used in the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition, Yanggakdo International Hotel and newly built buildings for decorations to give a formative and artistic representation.
					
					 Granite, abundant in the country, is colored by percolating a metallic oxide stable in terms of chemistry on the surface.
					
					 The colored granite, not affected by weather and other natural conditions, is also popular in foreign markets.
					
					 The coloring technology was presented by Pyongyang University of Printing.

articles.title: Dolmens Illustrative of Intellectual Faculties of Ancient Koreans
articles.content:
Dolmens Illustrative of Intellectual Faculties of Ancient Koreans
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The dolmen-related architecture shows intellectual faculties of the people in the period of Ancient Korea.
					 With a good knowledge of components of rock to be used in making dolmen, ancient Koreans made holes in the rock at regular intervals and drove expansive materials into them to cut off the part they wanted for dolmen.
					
					 Though several thousands of years have passed, the dolmens, for the most part, have still preserved their original state. That is because they were made by advanced architectural and mechanical methods.
					
					 Dolmens in the Pyongyang area have lids shaped like tortoise shell which needed so much work.
					
					 Some of the lids present not only shell but head and tail of tortoise in a vivid way.
					
					 They show the refined stone-processing skill and developed formative arts of ancient Koreans as well as their worship of tortoise, a symbol of longevity.
					
					 All the facts prove that the ancient Koreans' intellectual faculties such as stone-processing skill, architecture and formative arts were on a high level and they had been applied in their labor and life.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppets Commit Grave Military Provocation in West Sea
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppets Commit Grave Military Provocation in West Sea
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The bellicose forces of the south Korean puppet army committed a military provocation getting on the nerves of the DPRK in waters of the West Sea on the extension of the frontline on Dec. 17, according to a military source.
					 At about 14:20 that day, they staged an underwater explosion exercise three times close to the waters of the north side southeast of Kuwol Hill, Kangryong County, South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 The exercise conducted under the very nose of the north is a threat to it and an unpardonable criminal act against it.
					
					 The DPRK considers this as not a simple explosion exercise but cannot but interpret it otherwise than a premeditated provocation aimed to strain the situation in the militarily sensitive waters of the West Sea. 
					
					  The puppet war maniacs, far from drawing a lesson from the last armed conflict in the West Sea, are blustering that they would not rule out a "conflict", claiming that the puppet army would "preserve the northern limit line", an illegal one, and cope with a "renewed provocation" of someone, and deliberately provoking the DPRK, while reinforcing the group of warships in the West Sea.
					
					  The DPRK will deal a merciless retaliatory blow at the bellicose forces of the south Korean puppet army in case they persist in the military provocations in the West Sea while insisting on "preserving the northern limit line".

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Obstructing Reunification Movement
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Obstructing Reunification Movement
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration released a statement on December 13 denouncing the puppet Ministry of Unification for its anti-reunification act of blocking the non-governmental exchange between the north and the south.
					 The statement accused the ministry of "selectively disallowing" eight representatives including Ri Kang Sil, permanent steering member of the above-said committee, to participate in a meeting of the All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration slated to be opened in Shenyang.
					
					 The recent action taken by the ministry to block the participation of members of the progressive organization in a meeting under the pretext of "considering the present situation of the south-north relations, ensuring security and maintaining order," etc. was aimed at disturbing the non-governmental cooperation and exchange between the south and the north and putting a check-bar on the reunification movement of the progressive organizations, the statement noted, and warned:
					
					 If the "government" continues casting a chill over cooperation and exchange of non-governmental organizations, failing to properly solve the issue of the south-north relations, the above-said committee will strongly react to it by all means and methods.
					
					 The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea also issued a statement on the same day in which it held that the ministry's persistent suppression of the non-governmental reunification movement proves that it has no will to improve the inter-Korean relations. The committee will judge the anti-reunification forces through nationwide resistance, declared the statement.

articles.title: Angolan President on Friendly Ties with DPRK
articles.content:
Angolan President on Friendly Ties with DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Angola will continue boosting the friendly and cooperative relations and solidarity between the two parties and countries, said Angolan President Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola, when receiving the DPRK ambassador to Angola who headed the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea to the 6th Congress of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola on December 9.
					 He stressed that the WPK delegation's participation in the congress was an expression of friendship and solidarity of the WPK and the Korean people for the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola and its people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" was brought out in pamphlet on December 9 by a publishing house in Democratic Congo.
					 The work, published on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), describes 60 years covered by the DPRK as a great history of struggle and victory and creation and changes. And it clarifies the idea that even a small and backward country can turn into a developed and dignified power when it is led by the great leader and party, and tasks and ways for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche under the banner of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Birthday Observed in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Birthday Observed in Brazil
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The Brazil-Korea Friendship Association issued bulletin on Dec. 9 on the occasion of the 92nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine.
					 The bulletin in an article said that Kim Jong Suk conducted so energetic activities for the accomplishment of President Kim Il Sung's cause of nation-building not only in the days of the anti-Japanese struggle but also after the liberation of the country that she failed to visit her birthplace before her demise.
					
					It recalled that General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited every nook and corner of the country to translate her desire into reality but found no opportunity to visit Hoeryong.
					
					 He visited her birthplace in last February this year at last only after inspecting the Chollima Steel Complex in December last year to make the wave of the drive for effecting a new great revolutionary surge sweep the country, drawing the particular attention of the world community, it stressed.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre ministros de seguridad de Corea y China
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre ministros de seguridad de Corea y China
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 16 en el Gran Palacio del Pueblo de Beijing las conversaciones entre el ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ju Sang Song, y el ministro de Seguridad Publica de la Republica Popular China, Meng Jianzhu.
					En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion del MINSEP y el embajador coreano en China Choe Jin Su y por la china, el viceministro de Seguridad Publica, Meng Hongwei y otros funcionarios.
					
					Ambas partes compartieron criterios sobre el problema de promover el intercambio y desarrollar las relaciones de cooperacion entre los organos de seguridad de los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Firmado documento entre ministerios de seguridad de Corea y China
articles.content:
Firmado documento entre ministerios de seguridad de Corea y China
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 16 en Beijing el documento sobre el ofrecimiento de los materiales de cooperacion entre el Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el Ministerio de Seguridad Publica de la Republica Popular China.
					En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion del MINSEP presidida por el ministro Ju Sang Song  y el embajador coreano en China y por la china, el ministro de Seguridad Publica, Meng Jianzhu y otros funcionarios.
					
					Los titulares suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: Aplica tecnologia CNC a prensa de 10 mil toneladas
articles.content:
Aplica tecnologia CNC a prensa de 10 mil toneladas
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Complejo de Acero Chollima introdujo la tecnologia CNC en la prensa de diez mil toneladas, que tiene 25 metros de alto y  3 mil t del peso.
					  La fabricaron en la decada de 1980 los obreros de Ryongsong con sus propias fuerzas y tecnicas.
					
					   Gracias a la introduccion de tal tecnica de punta la capacidad productiva de esa maquina se aumento en 10 veces.
					
					  El sistema de control numerico por el ordenador permite controlar de manera libre y automatica el tipo, la presion, el grado de precision, el modo de forja, etc. segun el estado del material y producir solo con un manejo producto de forja con cientos de  toneladas del peso.
					
					  Se aumento en 10 veces la cantidad de la forja por la prensa y llego a cuatro veces el grado de precision del producto de forja en comparacion con el periodo anterior, lo cual permite enviar los productos casi acabados a las bases constructoras de maquinaria.
					
					  Por eso, fue reducido considerablemente el tiempo de elaboracion y elevado su nivel cualitativo.
					
					  Tambien, se disminuyo menos de la mitad la norma del consumo de materiales por unidad de produccion porque fue ahorrado 60% de la cantidad del consumo de la energia y agua necesarias a la creacion de presion.
					
					  La modernizada prensa produce a su gusto los grandes productos de forja como el eje de la turbina y el platillo rotatorio del generador electrico y el cilindro del laminador, necesarios a las Centrales Hidroelectricas de Huichon y Kumyagang, el Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek y otros lugares de la construccion socialista.

articles.title: Presidente angoleno se refiere al desarrollo de relaciones con Corea
articles.content:
Presidente angoleno se refiere al desarrollo de relaciones con Corea
  Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, presidente de la Republica de Angola y del Movimiento Popular de Liberacion de Angola (MPLA), se reunio el dia 9 con el embajador coreano en su pais quien participo en el 6o congreso del MPLA en calidad de jefe de la delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					  En la ocasion el mandatario africano afirmo que seguiria fortaleciendo y desarrollando las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion y la solidaridad entre ambos partidos y paises.
					
					  Subrayo que la participacion de la delegacion del PTC en el 6o congreso del MPLA deviene una muestra de amistad y solidaridad del PTC y del pueblo coreano hacia su partido y pueblo.
